Class Utility.Console.Colors

java.lang.Object
Uno.Utility.Console.Colors
Enclosing class:
Utility.Console
public static class Utility.Console.Colors extends Object
The Colors class provides a collection of ANSI escape codes for text formatting, including colors and backgrounds, in supported terminal environments. These constants can be used to modify text appearance in the console, such as changing text colors, background colors, or resetting formatting.

The behavior of these codes depends on the terminal's support for ANSI escape codes and may not function in non-compliant environments.

Text color constants: - BLACK, RED, GREEN, YELLOW, BLUE, PURPLE, CYAN, WHITE

Background color constants: - BLACK_BACKGROUND, RED_BACKGROUND, GREEN_BACKGROUND, YELLOW_BACKGROUND, BLUE_BACKGROUND, PURPLE_BACKGROUND, CYAN_BACKGROUND, WHITE_BACKGROUND

Use RESET to reset formatting back to the default state.
